titles: A most notable example of an vngracious son, who in the pride of his heart denyed his owne father and how God for his offence, turned his meat into loathsome toades. To the tune of Lord Darley.
Most notable and worthy example of an ungratious sonne, who in the pride of his hart denied his owne father.
publisher: printed by M. P[arsons] for H. Gosson, on London Bridge,
notes: An earlier edition has title: A most notable and worthy example of an ungratious sonne, who in the pride of his hart denied his owne father.
Printer's name and publication date suggested by STC.
Formerly STC 10609; identified as STC 10609 on UMI microfilm (Early English books, 1641-1700) reel 2123.
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
